title: What happens to your body when you work more than 40 hours a week
text:
In the Dolly Parton song, working 9 to 5 is painted as a terrible way to make a living. Yet almost forty years on from the song's release, those working hours seem positively cushy.

Even if your official working hours are 9 to 5, or even 10 to 6, you might not remember the last time you left the office on time. Not only does this have an impact on your personal life, but a new study suggests there are health-related side effects to working long hours.

Working more than 52 hours per week could lead to premature hair loss, according to a South Korean study recently published in the Annals of Occupational and Environmental Medicine journal. Researchers found that men who spent more than 52 hours...
description: In the Dolly Parton song, working 9 to 5 is painted as a terrible way to make a living.
